DOC.brief_title: Manual Therapy Exercises Applied Cervical Spine Patients With Temporomandibular Disorders
DOC.detailed_description: Temporomandibular disorder ( TMD ) general term refers disorder associate temporomandibular joint ( TMJ ) masticatory muscle . Among main symptom pre-auricular pain ( region TMJ ) and/or pain masticatory muscle . It 's usual observe subject TMD also present cervical alteration . Beside , cervical postural alteration produce muscle tension influence mandibular position . The intervention protocol base manual therapy , stabilization exercise stretch . The technique : . 1 . Upper cervical flexion mobilization ; 2 . C5 central posterior-anterior mobilization ; 3 . Stabilization exercise : Cranio-cervical flexor stabilization exercise 4 . Stretching muscle : upper trapezius , scalenes , semispinalis capitis ; splenius capitis , sternocleidomastoid
DOC.criteria: Patients diagnose myogenic mixed temporomandibular disorder Patients diagnose arthrogenic discogenic temporomandibular disorder
